title: [Large-Scale] Quantitative Evaluation-Based Project-Based Learning for Intuitive Interface Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic principles of user experience (UX) design and foundational statistical analysis methods in social sciences
context.additional_context: Focused on smartphone-based interface design, iterative improvement through prototype development for real social problem-solving and quantitative evaluation

learning_goals: Learners can analyze schema operation types by interface status/function and derive intuitiveness (IU) metrics using quantitative evaluation tools.
Learners can design smartphone-based interface prototypes in resource-constrained environments and evaluate schema transfer and induction processes through user testing.
Learners can propose interface design improvements based on assessment results and verify their applicability for solving social issues

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
